title: Save the date: ESA’s Living Planet Symposium 2025
summary: Save the date for ESA’s next Living Planet Symposium, set for 23–27 June 2025 at the Austria Center Vienna. Held every three years, this premier Earth observation conference continues to expand in both size and scope. With the climate crisis intensifying, this event emphasises transitioning from ‘observation to climate action and sustainability for Earth’. Don't miss it!

title: PLD Space Likely to Be the First to Use New Launch Complex in Kourou
summary: ESA director of space transportation Toni Tolker-Nielsen has revealed that PLD Space is likely to be the first company to launch a rocket from the new commercial launch complex being built on the grounds of the Guiana Space Centre. In early 2021, the French space agency CNES announced plans to open up the Guiana Space […]

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy June 23-29, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of June 23-29, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House is in session this week. […]

title: Chang’e-6 heads for Earth with first-ever lunar far side samples
summary: China’s Chang’e-6 spacecraft is on its way to Earth to deliver samples collected from the far side of the moon.

title: SpaceX completes Falcon 9 double launch day with Starlink mission from Vandenberg Space Force Station
summary: The mission marked SpaceX's second launch of the day. Liftoff happened at 8:47 p.m. PDT (11:47 p.m. EDT, 0347 UTC).

title: China launches Sino-French astrophysics satellite, debris falls over populated area
summary: A Chinese launch of the joint Sino-French SVOM mission to study Gamma-ray bursts early Saturday saw toxic rocket debris fall over a populated area.

title: Synspective raises $44 million Series C round
summary: Japanese radar imaging company Synspective has raised 7 billion yen ($44 million) in a Series C round intended to fuel the expansion of its satellite constellation.

title: SpaceX marks record 20th flight with Falcon 9 payload fairing half on Starlink mission
summary: SpaceX swapped out the Falcon 9 vehicle after a last-second abort at engine ignition during a launch attempt on June 14. Liftoff of the Starlink 10-2 mission happened at 1:15 p.m. EDT (1715 UTC) on Sunday.

title: Starliner Mission Extended, All Systems Stable
summary: Boeing’s Starliner Crew Flight Test (CFT) has once more been extended, but everything remains stable and safe for the station, spacecraft, and crew. A new return date has yet to be determined, but it will be no earlier than early July.

title: NASA again delays Starliner undocking, return to Earth
summary: NASA and Boeing managers have again decided to extend the Starliner crew capsule's stay at the International Space Station, passing up a June 26 re-entry to allow more time for analysis and testing to make sure helium leaks and thruster failures are fully understood, officials said late Friday.
